metadata.title: CVE-2009-0195 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in Xpdf 3.02pl2 and earlier, CUPS 1.3.9, and probably other products, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a PDF file with crafted JBIG2 symbol dictionary segments.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2009-0195` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler111 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
poppler-utils - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> Probably the same issue as CVE-2009-0146 fixed by usn-759-1 even though the CVE is not listed in it sbeattie> ipe uses system pdflatex

criterions.comment: libextractor package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
poppler package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.5-1ubuntu2').
